title: Verbal Description: Barack Obama
transcript:
Kehinde Wiley painted this portrait, titled Barack Obama, in 2018. The medium is oil on canvas. The
painting is over seven feet tall and nearly five feet wide. At its center, Barack Obama sits in a carved
wooden chair, looking straight at the viewer. His chair is partially enveloped by a backdrop of lush foliage
in a range of greens, including deep aqua and jade, extending to all edges of the canvas. Occasional
blossoms in orange, pink, white, and purple dot the scene.

President Obama wears an all-black suit, black shoes, and a white collared shirt. The top few buttons of
his shirt are open in a casual manner. He sits with his feet firmly planted, knees wide apart and arms
folded, elbows resting on his knees. The skin of his face and hands shines in golden-brown hues, and his
black hair is tinged with gray. He gazes straight ahead with an expression that is calm, confident, and
engaged.

The entire portrait is rendered in realistic detail, but the brightness of its colors give it a heightened,
almost fantastic quality. So does its leafy setting. Imagine a wall of greenery, and nestled in it is a man in

a chair, any sense of ground obscured by the foliage beneath him. The president appears abstractly
situated in this way, individual leaves overlapping the chair, his clothes, and his shoes.
